name: wastewater treatment facility construction, lagoon, capacity 1.1E10l/year | wastewater treatment facility, capacity 1.1E10l/year | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11565/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of a small size (class 4) wastewaster facultative aereted lagoons treatment facility. Average flow rate for this class is 30116 m3/d (1.1E10 l/yr) with a lifetime of 40 years.  Lagoon treatment includes influent pumping station, ponds and UV disinfection.  Dataset is extrapolated from a one lagoon facility in Quebec (CA): average flow of 8050 m3/d. Inventory is extrapolated to a small size plant based on cost curve. 

From reception of raw materials and construction equipment. This dataset includes material inputs for equipment of the different water treatment stages ( influent pumping, aeration, pond construction, UV desinfection) and energy for construction. Equipment needed for construction, UV equipment and processing of material  are excluded due to lack of data.

This datasets ends with the dismantlement of the plant at the end of its useful life, expected to be 40 years. Clay and gravel material are assumed to be left on site. Input material end-of-life is included, but equipment and energy used for dismantling is excluded due to lack of data.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Waste Treatment & Recycling

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data provided from literature and measurements from a single treatment plant in Quebec.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Wastewater treatement plant, facultative aerated lagoon
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
From one single lagoon treatment facility to construction of all Quebec medium-sized lagoon facility. Extrapolation is based on scaling initial inventory to average size plant using published cost scaling curves from EPA (1980). This approach assumes that the economic scaling factor is applicable to material quantity. Cost-based scaling factor, usually used to account for economies of scale, Dataset is parameterized based on average flow. Note that the factor is reported to be valid for a capacity range of 190 m3/d to 20 000 m3/d.

US EPA. 1980. Construction costs for municipal wastewater treatment plants : 1973-1978. Report: EPA/430/9-80-003; FRD-11. U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Water Program Operations.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on data collection at plan published in Godin, D. (2012).
